p: In recent years, an important HIV outbreak was reported among PWID in Romania, with 30.6% of the total newly diagnosed HIV cases in the country in 2012 [ 9]. The most affected region was Bucharest and its suburbs where more than 90% of Romanian PWID are living [ 10]. The Romanian PWID infected with HIV are mainly young males, unemployed, often diagnosed in penitentiary, who inject both heroin and new psychoactive drugs („legal highs”), and are frequently co-infected with HCV. Two predominant HIV strains were identified in PWID: subtype F1 which had already been circulating in sexual and nosocomially infected patients and the newly endemic CRF14_BG, most probably originating in Spain or Portugal [ 11, 12].
